commitMessage:
@@@[FLINK-18934][runtime] Idle stream does not advance watermark in connected stream

Watermark in the two and multi input operators is computed in operators. So far operators were unaware of the StreamStatus.  therefore even if a whole input was IDLE it could still block increasing the Watermark.

This commit makes operators aware of the StreamStatus. The contract of the StreamStatus is that if a stream is IDLE it should not emit records nor watermarks.

@@@[hotfix] Rename Input#emitStreamStatus to processStreamStatus

This closes #16145

@@@[FLINK-23767][streaming] Rename StreamStatus to WatermarkStatus.

git grep -l 'streamStatus' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/streamStatus/watermarkStatus/g'
git grep -l 'StreamStatus' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/StreamStatus/WatermarkStatus/g'
git grep -l 'streamstatus' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/streamstatus/watermarkstatus/g'
git grep -l 'Stream Status' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/Stream Status/Watermark Status/g'
git grep -l 'Stream status' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/Stream status/Watermark status/g'
git grep -l 'stream status' | xargs sed -i '' -e 's/stream status/watermark status/g'
Renamed class StreamStatus(Test) -> WatermarkStatus(Test)
Renamed package streamstatus -> watermarkstatus
Reverted Kinesis as it does have a real StreamStatus
mvn spotless:apply
